content.text:
Now, let's create a new Java class for our automation test. First, we need to add Selenium dependencies. Since this is a simple Java project without Maven or Gradle, we'll need to download the Selenium JAR files manually.

Let's create our test class first:
Now, let's create a README file with instructions on how to set up and run this test:

content.lineBasedDiff:
--- src/automation/README.md
+++ src/automation/README.md
@@ -0,0 +1,55 @@
+# Selenium Automation Test for IndiaMART
+
+This is a simple Selenium WebDriver test that automates searching for "Mobile Phone" on the IndiaMART website.
+
+## Prerequisites
+
+1. Java JDK 8 or higher installed
+2. Selenium WebDriver JAR files
+3. ChromeDriver executable
+
+## Setup Instructions
+
+### 1. Download Selenium WebDriver JAR files
+
+Download the following JAR files and add them to your project's classpath:
+- Selenium Java Client: https://www.selenium.dev/downloads/
+- Selenium Server: https://www.selenium.dev/downloads/
+
+### 2. Download ChromeDriver
+
+1. Go to https://chromedriver.chromium.org/downloads
+2. Download the version that matches your Chrome browser version
+3. Extract the executable and note its location
+
+### 3. Update the ChromeDriver path
+
+In the `IndiaMartSearchTest.java` file, update the following line with the path to your ChromeDriver executable:
+
+```java
+System.setProperty("webdriver.chrome.driver", "path_to_chromedriver.exe");
+```
+
+For example:
+```java
+System.setProperty("webdriver.chrome.driver", "C:/WebDrivers/chromedriver.exe");
+```
+
+## Running the Test
+
+1. Compile the Java file
+2. Run the compiled class
+
+## Test Steps
+
+The test performs the following actions:
+1. Navigate to https://www.indiamart.com
+2. Type "Mobile Phone" in the search box
+3. Click on the search button
+4. Verify that search results are displayed
+
+## Troubleshooting
+
+- If the test fails to find elements, the website's HTML structure might have changed. Update the element locators in the code.
+- Make sure you're using the correct version of ChromeDriver that matches your Chrome browser version.
+- Check that all required JAR files are in your classpath.

Now, let's create a setup guide to help you run this test:

content.lineBasedDiff:
--- src/automation/SETUP_GUIDE.md
+++ src/automation/SETUP_GUIDE.md
@@ -0,0 +1,93 @@
+# Selenium WebDriver Setup Guide
+
+This guide will help you set up Selenium WebDriver to run the IndiaMART search test.
+
+## Step 1: Download Required JAR Files
+
+1. **Selenium WebDriver JAR files**:
+   - Go to: https://www.selenium.dev/downloads/
+   - Download the latest Java version (e.g., "Java (Selenium Server)")
+   - Extract the ZIP file to get the JAR files
+
+2. **Create a 'lib' folder** in your project:
+   ```
+   C:/Users/imart/IdeaProjects/LearningJavaATB13X/lib
+   ```
+
+3. **Copy all the JAR files** from the extracted Selenium folder to your project's 'lib' folder.
+
+## Step 2: Download ChromeDriver
+
+1. **Check your Chrome version**:
+   - Open Chrome
+   - Click the three dots in the top-right corner
+   - Go to Help > About Google Chrome
+   - Note your Chrome version (e.g., 114.0.5735.199)
+
+2. **Download matching ChromeDriver**:
+   - Go to: https://chromedriver.chromium.org/downloads
+   - Download the ChromeDriver version that matches your Chrome version
+   - Extract the ZIP file to get the chromedriver.exe file
+
+3. **Create a 'drivers' folder** in your project:
+   ```
+   C:/Users/imart/IdeaProjects/LearningJavaATB13X/drivers
+   ```
+
+4. **Copy chromedriver.exe** to your project's 'drivers' folder.
+
+## Step 3: Update the ChromeDriver Path in the Code
+
+Open the `IndiaMartSearchTest.java` file and update the ChromeDriver path:
+
+```java
+// Change this line:
+System.setProperty("webdriver.chrome.driver", "path_to_chromedriver.exe");
+
+// To this (use the correct path to your chromedriver.exe):
+System.setProperty("webdriver.chrome.driver", "C:/Users/imart/IdeaProjects/LearningJavaATB13X/drivers/chromedriver.exe");
+```
+
+## Step 4: Add JAR Files to Your Project Classpath
+
+### In IntelliJ IDEA:
+1. Go to File > Project Structure
+2. Select "Modules" in the left panel
+3. Go to the "Dependencies" tab
+4. Click the "+" button and select "JARs or directories"
+5. Navigate to your project's 'lib' folder and select all JAR files
+6. Click "OK" to add them to your classpath
+
+## Step 5: Run the Test
+
+1. Right-click on the `IndiaMartSearchTest.java` file in the Project Explorer
+2. Select "Run 'IndiaMartSearchTest.main()'"
+
+## Troubleshooting
+
+### Common Issues:
+
+1. **Element Not Found Exceptions**:
+   - The website structure might have changed
+   - Try updating the XPath selectors in the code
+
+2. **ChromeDriver Version Mismatch**:
+   - Error message: "This version of ChromeDriver only supports Chrome version XX"
+   - Solution: Download the matching ChromeDriver version
+
+3. **Missing Dependencies**:
+   - Error message: "NoClassDefFoundError" or "ClassNotFoundException"
+   - Solution: Make sure all required JAR files are in your classpath
+
+4. **Browser Closes Immediately**:
+   - Add a delay before closing the browser:
+   ```java
+   // Add before driver.quit():
+   Thread.sleep(5000); // 5-second delay
+   ```
+
+## Additional Resources
+
+- Selenium Documentation: https://www.selenium.dev/documentation/
+- ChromeDriver Documentation: https://chromedriver.chromium.org/
+- XPath Tutorial: https://www.w3schools.com/xml/xpath_intro.asp

content.text: Now, let's create a more robust version of the test that handles potential variations in the IndiaMART website structure:
Finally, let's create a simple batch file to help you run the test after setting up:

content.lineBasedDiff:
--- src/automation/run_test.bat
+++ src/automation/run_test.bat
@@ -0,0 +1,51 @@
+@echo off
+echo Running IndiaMART Search Test...
+echo.
+
+REM Check if chromedriver.exe exists
+if not exist "..\..\drivers\chromedriver.exe" (
+    echo ERROR: chromedriver.exe not found in drivers folder!
+    echo Please download chromedriver.exe and place it in the drivers folder.
+    echo See SETUP_GUIDE.md for instructions.
+    pause
+    exit /b 1
+)
+
+REM Check if Selenium JAR files exist
+if not exist "..\..\lib\*.jar" (
+    echo ERROR: Selenium JAR files not found in lib folder!
+    echo Please download Selenium JAR files and place them in the lib folder.
+    echo See SETUP_GUIDE.md for instructions.
+    pause
+    exit /b 1
+)
+
+REM Set classpath to include all JAR files in the lib folder
+setlocal EnableDelayedExpansion
+set CLASSPATH=..\..\
+for %%i in ("..\..\lib\*.jar") do (
+    set CLASSPATH=!CLASSPATH!;%%i
+)
+
+REM Compile the Java file
+echo Compiling Java files...
+javac -cp "%CLASSPATH%" IndiaMartSearchTestEnhanced.java
+if %ERRORLEVEL% neq 0 (
+    echo ERROR: Compilation failed!
+    pause
+    exit /b 1
+)
+
+REM Run the test
+echo.
+echo Starting test...
+java -cp "%CLASSPATH%;..\.." automation.IndiaMartSearchTestEnhanced
+if %ERRORLEVEL% neq 0 (
+    echo.
+    echo Test execution failed with error code %ERRORLEVEL%
+) else (
+    echo.
+    echo Test completed successfully!
+)
+
+pause

content.text:
## Summary of What I've Created

I've set up a complete Selenium WebDriver test suite to automate the IndiaMART search task. Here's what I've created:

1. **Basic Test Script** (`IndiaMartSearchTest.java`):
   - Navigates to IndiaMART website
   - Searches for "Mobile Phone"
   - Verifies search results are displayed

2. **Enhanced Test Script** (`IndiaMartSearchTestEnhanced.java`):
   - More robust with multiple strategies to find elements
   - Better error handling and reporting
   - Takes screenshots for debugging
   - Comprehensive verification of search results

3. **Setup Guide** (`SETUP_GUIDE.md`):
   - Step-by-step instructions for setting up Selenium WebDriver
   - How to download and configure ChromeDriver
   - How to add dependencies to your project
   - Troubleshooting common issues

4. **Batch File** (`run_test.bat`):
   - Helps compile and run the test after setup
   - Checks for required files before running
   - Provides clear error messages if something is missing

## Next Steps

To run the test, you'll need to:

1. **Create the required folders**:
   - `C:/Users/imart/IdeaProjects/LearningJavaATB13X/lib` (for Selenium JAR files)
   - `C:/Users/imart/IdeaProjects/LearningJavaATB13X/drivers` (for ChromeDriver)

2. **Download the required files**:
   - Selenium WebDriver JAR files
   - ChromeDriver that matches your Chrome browser version

3. **Update the ChromeDriver path** in the code if needed

4. **Run the test** using one of these methods:
   - Execute the batch file: `run_test.bat`
   - Run from your IDE (IntelliJ IDEA)

The test will:
1. Open Chrome browser
2. Navigate to IndiaMART website
3. Type "Mobile Phone" in the search box
4. Click the search button
5. Verify that search results are displayed
6. Take screenshots during the process for debugging

Would you like me to explain any specific part of the implementation in more detail?

Type %22Mobile Phone%22 in the search box%0D%0A3. Click on the search button%0D%0A4. Verify that search results are displayed%0D%0A%0D%0A## Troubleshooting%0D%0A%0D%0A- If the test fails to find elements, the website's HTML structure might have changed. Update the element locators in the code.%0D%0A- Make sure you're using the correct version of ChromeDriver that matches your Chrome browser version.%0D%0A- Check that all required JAR files are in your classpath.

@@ -0,0 +1,4189 @@
+package automation;%0D%0A%0D%0Aimport org.openqa.selenium.By;%0D%0Aimport org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;%0D%0Aimport org.openqa.selenium.WebElement;%0D%0Aimport org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver;%0D%0Aimport org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeOptions;%0D%0Aimport org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.ExpectedConditions;%0D%0Aimport org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.WebDriverWait;%0D%0A%0D%0Aimport java.time.Duration;%0D%0A%0D%0Apublic class IndiaMartSearchTest %7B%0D%0A    %0D%0A    public static void main(String%5B%5D args) %7B%0D%0A        // Set the path to the ChromeDriver executable%0D%0A        // You'll need to download ChromeDriver from https://chromedriver.chromium.org/downloads%0D%0A        // and update this path to where you saved it%0D%0A        System.setProperty(%22webdriver.chrome.driver%22, %22path_to_chromedriver.exe%22);%0D%0A        %0D%0A        // Configure Chrome options%0D%0A        ChromeOptions options = new ChromeOptions();%0D%0A        // options.addArguments(%22--headless%22); // Uncomment if you want to run in headless mode%0D%0A        %0D%0A        // Initialize the WebDriver%0D%0A        WebDriver driver = new ChromeDriver(options);%0D%0A        %0D%0A        try %7B%0D%0A            // Step 1: Go to IndiaMART website%0D%0A            System.out.println(%22Navigating to IndiaMART...%22);%0D%0A            driver.get(%22https://www.indiamart.com%22);%0D%0A            %0D%0A            // Wait for the page to load completely%0D%0A            WebDriverWait wait = new WebDriverWait(driver, Duration.ofSeconds(10));%0D%0A            %0D%0A            // Step 2: Find the search box and type %22Mobile Phone%22%0D%0A            System.out.println(%22Typing 'Mobile Phone' in search box...%22);%0D%0A            // Using XPath to find the search input field - we'll look for an input field with a search-related attribute%0D%0A            WebElement searchBox = wait.until(ExpectedConditions.elementToBeClickable(%0D%0A                By.xpath(%22//input%5B@type='text' and contains(@placeholder, 'Enter product/service name')%5D%22)));%0D%0A            searchBox.clear();%0D%0A            searchBox.sendKeys(%22Mobile Phone%22);%0D%0A            %0D%0A            // Step 3: Click on search button%0D%0A            System.out.println(%22Clicking search button...%22);%0D%0A            // Using XPath to find the search button - typically a button near the search box%0D%0A            WebElement searchButton = driver.findElement(%0D%0A                By.xpath(%22//button%5Bcontains(@class, 'search') or contains(@type, 'submit')%5D%22));%0D%0A            searchButton.click();%0D%0A            %0D%0A            // Step 4: Verify that results are displayed%0D%0A            System.out.println(%22Verifying search results...%22);%0D%0A            // Wait for search results to appear - looking for common result page elements%0D%0A            WebElement searchResults = wait.until(ExpectedConditions.visibilityOfElementLocated(%0D%0A                By.xpath(%22//div%5Bcontains(@class, 'product') or contains(@class, 'result') or contains(@id, 'search')%5D%22)));%0D%0A            %0D%0A            if (searchResults.isDisplayed()) %7B%0D%0A                System.out.println(%22TEST PASSED: Search results for 'Mobile Phone' are displayed successfully!%22);%0D%0A                %0D%0A                // Additional verification - check if the page title contains the search term%0D%0A                if (driver.getTitle().toLowerCase().contains(%22mobile phone%22)) %7B%0D%0A                    System.out.println(%22Verification successful: Page title contains 'mobile phone'%22);%0D%0A                %7D else %7B%0D%0A                    System.out.println(%22Note: Page title does not contain 'mobile phone', but results are displayed%22);%0D%0A                %7D%0D%0A                %0D%0A                // Check if any product listings are visible%0D%0A                int productCount = driver.findElements(By.xpath(%22//div%5Bcontains(@class, 'product')%5D%22)).size();%0D%0A                System.out.println(%22Found %22 + productCount + %22 product elements on the page%22);%0D%0A            %7D else %7B%0D%0A                System.out.println(%22TEST FAILED: Search results are not displayed.%22);%0D%0A            %7D%0D%0A            %0D%0A        %7D catch (Exception e) %7B%0D%0A            System.out.println(%22TEST FAILED with exception: %22 + e.getMessage());%0D%0A            e.printStackTrace();%0D%0A        %7D finally %7B%0D%0A            // Close the browser%0D%0A            driver.quit();%0D%0A            System.out.println(%22Test completed.%22);%0D%0A        %7D%0D%0A    %7D%0D%0A%7D

Select %22Run 'IndiaMartSearchTest.main()'%22%0D%0A%0D%0A## Troubleshooting%0D%0A%0D%0A### Common Issues:%0D%0A%0D%0A1. **Element Not Found Exceptions**:%0D%0A   - The website structure might have changed%0D%0A   - Try updating the XPath selectors in the code%0D%0A%0D%0A2. **ChromeDriver Version Mismatch**:%0D%0A   - Error message: %22This version of ChromeDriver only supports Chrome version XX%22%0D%0A   - Solution: Download the matching ChromeDriver version%0D%0A%0D%0A3. **Missing Dependencies**:%0D%0A   - Error message: %22NoClassDefFoundError%22 or %22ClassNotFoundException%22%0D%0A   - Solution: Make sure all required JAR files are in your classpath%0D%0A%0D%0A4. **Browser Closes Immediately**:%0D%0A   - Add a delay before closing the browser:%0D%0A   %60%60%60java%0D%0A   // Add before driver.quit():%0D%0A   Thread.sleep(5000); // 5-second delay%0D%0A   %60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A## Additional Resources%0D%0A%0D%0A- Selenium Documentation: https://www.selenium.dev/documentation/%0D%0A- ChromeDriver Documentation: https://chromedriver.chromium.org/%0D%0A- XPath Tutorial: https://www.w3schools.com/xml/xpath_intro.asp

+package automation;%0D%0A%0D%0Aimport org.openqa.selenium.*;%0D%0Aimport org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver;%0D%0Aimport org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeOptions;%0D%0Aimport org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.ExpectedConditions;%0D%0Aimport org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.WebDriverWait;%0D%0A%0D%0Aimport java.time.Duration;%0D%0Aimport java.util.List;%0D%0A%0D%0A/**%0D%0A * Enhanced version of the IndiaMART search test with better error handling%0D%0A * and multiple strategies for finding elements.%0D%0A */%0D%0Apublic class IndiaMartSearchTestEnhanced %7B%0D%0A    %0D%0A    public static void main(String%5B%5D args) %7B%0D%0A        // Set the path to the ChromeDriver executable%0D%0A        System.setProperty(%22webdriver.chrome.driver%22, %22C:/Users/imart/IdeaProjects/LearningJavaATB13X/drivers/chromedriver.exe%22);%0D%0A        %0D%0A        // Configure Chrome options%0D%0A        ChromeOptions options = new ChromeOptions();%0D%0A        options.addArguments(%22--start-maximized%22); // Start with maximized browser%0D%0A        %0D%0A        // Initialize the WebDriver%0D%0A        WebDriver driver = new ChromeDriver(options);%0D%0A        WebDriverWait wait = new WebDriverWait(driver, Duration.ofSeconds(10));%0D%0A        %0D%0A        try %7B%0D%0A            // Step 1: Go to IndiaMART website%0D%0A            System.out.println(%22Navigating to IndiaMART...%22);%0D%0A            driver.get(%22https://www.indiamart.com%22);%0D%0A            %0D%0A            // Take a screenshot of the homepage%0D%0A            takeScreenshot(driver, %22homepage%22);%0D%0A            %0D%0A            // Step 2: Find the search box and type %22Mobile Phone%22%0D%0A            System.out.println(%22Typing 'Mobile Phone' in search box...%22);%0D%0A            WebElement searchBox = findSearchBox(driver, wait);%0D%0A            %0D%0A            if (searchBox != null) %7B%0D%0A                searchBox.clear();%0D%0A                searchBox.sendKeys(%22Mobile Phone%22);%0D%0A                System.out.println(%22Successfully entered 'Mobile Phone' in the search box%22);%0D%0A                %0D%0A                // Take a screenshot after typing%0D%0A                takeScreenshot(driver, %22after_typing%22);%0D%0A                %0D%0A                // Step 3: Click on search button%0D%0A                System.out.println(%22Clicking search button...%22);%0D%0A                WebElement searchButton = findSearchButton(driver, searchBox);%0D%0A                %0D%0A                if (searchButton != null) %7B%0D%0A                    searchButton.click();%0D%0A                    System.out.println(%22Successfully clicked the search button%22);%0D%0A                    %0D%0A                    // Step 4: Verify that results are displayed%0D%0A                    System.out.println(%22Verifying search results...%22);%0D%0A                    boolean resultsDisplayed = verifySearchResults(driver, wait);%0D%0A                    %0D%0A                    // Take a screenshot of the results page%0D%0A                    takeScreenshot(driver, %22search_results%22);%0D%0A                    %0D%0A                    if (resultsDisplayed) %7B%0D%0A                        System.out.println(%22TEST PASSED: Search results for 'Mobile Phone' are displayed successfully!%22);%0D%0A                    %7D else %7B%0D%0A                        System.out.println(%22TEST FAILED: Could not verify search results.%22);%0D%0A                    %7D%0D%0A                %7D else %7B%0D%0A                    System.out.println(%22TEST FAILED: Could not find the search button.%22);%0D%0A                %7D%0D%0A            %7D else %7B%0D%0A                System.out.println(%22TEST FAILED: Could not find the search box.%22);%0D%0A            %7D%0D%0A            %0D%0A        %7D catch (Exception e) %7B%0D%0A            System.out.println(%22TEST FAILED with exception: %22 + e.getMessage());%0D%0A            e.printStackTrace();%0D%0A            %0D%0A            // Take a screenshot on error%0D%0A            takeScreenshot(driver, %22error%22);%0D%0A        %7D finally %7B%0D%0A            // Add a delay before closing to see the final state%0D%0A            try %7B%0D%0A                Thread.sleep(3000);%0D%0A            %7D catch (InterruptedException e) %7B%0D%0A                e.printStackTrace();%0D%0A            %7D%0D%0A            %0D%0A            // Close the browser%0D%0A            driver.quit();%0D%0A            System.out.println(%22Test completed.%22);%0D%0A        %7D%0D%0A    %7D%0D%0A    %0D%0A    /**%0D%0A     * Find the search box using multiple strategies%0D%0A     */%0D%0A    private static WebElement findSearchBox(WebDriver driver, WebDriverWait wait) %7B%0D%0A        WebElement searchBox = null;%0D%0A        %0D%0A        // List of strategies to find the search box%0D%0A        List%3CBy%3E searchBoxLocators = List.of(%0D%0A            // Strategy 1: Find by placeholder text%0D%0A            By.xpath(%22//input%5Bcontains(@placeholder, 'product') or contains(@placeholder, 'search')%5D%22),%0D%0A            // Strategy 2: Find by common search input attributes%0D%0A            By.xpath(%22//input%5B@type='text' and (@name='q' or @name='search' or @name='query' or contains(@class, 'search'))%5D%22),%0D%0A            // Strategy 3: Find by common search input IDs%0D%0A            By.xpath(%22//input%5Bcontains(@id, 'search') or contains(@id, 'query') or contains(@id, 'keyword')%5D%22),%0D%0A            // Strategy 4: Find any input with search-related attributes%0D%0A            By.xpath(%22//input%5B@type='text' and (@title contains 'search' or @aria-label contains 'search')%5D%22),%0D%0A            // Strategy 5: Find by common form structure%0D%0A            By.xpath(%22//form//input%5B@type='text'%5D%22)%0D%0A        );%0D%0A        %0D%0A        // Try each strategy until we find the search box%0D%0A        for (By locator : searchBoxLocators) %7B%0D%0A            try %7B%0D%0A                searchBox = wait.until(ExpectedConditions.elementToBeClickable(locator));%0D%0A                System.out.println(%22Found search box using: %22 + locator);%0D%0A                return searchBox;%0D%0A            %7D catch (TimeoutException e) %7B%0D%0A                System.out.println(%22Could not find search box using: %22 + locator);%0D%0A            %7D%0D%0A        %7D%0D%0A        %0D%0A        // If all strategies fail, try JavaScript as a last resort%0D%0A        try %7B%0D%0A            System.out.println(%22Trying to find search box using JavaScript...%22);%0D%0A            searchBox = (WebElement) ((JavascriptExecutor) driver).executeScript(%0D%0A                %22return document.querySelector('input%5Btype=%5C%22text%5C%22%5D');%22%0D%0A            );%0D%0A            if (searchBox != null && searchBox.isDisplayed()) %7B%0D%0A                System.out.println(%22Found search box using JavaScript%22);%0D%0A                return searchBox;%0D%0A            %7D%0D%0A        %7D catch (Exception e) %7B%0D%0A            System.out.println(%22JavaScript search failed: %22 + e.getMessage());%0D%0A        %7D%0D%0A        %0D%0A        return null;%0D%0A    %7D%0D%0A    %0D%0A    /**%0D%0A     * Find the search button using multiple strategies%0D%0A     */%0D%0A    private static WebElement findSearchButton(WebDriver driver, WebElement searchBox) %7B%0D%0A        WebElement searchButton = null;%0D%0A        %0D%0A        // List of strategies to find the search button%0D%0A        List%3CBy%3E searchButtonLocators = List.of(%0D%0A            // Strategy 1: Find button by type and text%0D%0A            By.xpath(%22//button%5B@type='submit' or contains(text(), 'Search')%5D%22),%0D%0A            // Strategy 2: Find button by common search button classes%0D%0A            By.xpath(%22//button%5Bcontains(@class, 'search') or contains(@class, 'submit')%5D%22),%0D%0A            // Strategy 3: Find input with type submit%0D%0A            By.xpath(%22//input%5B@type='submit'%5D%22),%0D%0A            // Strategy 4: Find any element with search icon class%0D%0A            By.xpath(%22//*%5Bcontains(@class, 'search-icon') or contains(@class, 'fa-search')%5D%22),%0D%0A            // Strategy 5: Find button near the search box%0D%0A            By.xpath(%22//input%5B@type='text'%5D/following::button%5B1%5D%22)%0D%0A        );%0D%0A        %0D%0A        // Try each strategy until we find the search button%0D%0A        for (By locator : searchButtonLocators) %7B%0D%0A            try %7B%0D%0A                searchButton = driver.findElement(locator);%0D%0A                if (searchButton.isDisplayed() && searchButton.isEnabled()) %7B%0D%0A                    System.out.println(%22Found search button using: %22 + locator);%0D%0A                    return searchButton;%0D%0A                %7D%0D%0A            %7D catch (NoSuchElementException e) %7B%0D%0A                System.out.println(%22Could not find search button using: %22 + locator);%0D%0A            %7D%0D%0A        %7D%0D%0A        %0D%0A        // If all strategies fail, try to find the closest button to the search box%0D%0A        try %7B%0D%0A            System.out.println(%22Trying to find the closest button to the search box...%22);%0D%0A            // Get the parent form if it exists%0D%0A            WebElement form = searchBox.findElement(By.xpath(%22./ancestor::form%22));%0D%0A            searchButton = form.findElement(By.xpath(%22.//button %7C .//input%5B@type='submit'%5D%22));%0D%0A            if (searchButton != null && searchButton.isDisplayed()) %7B%0D%0A                System.out.println(%22Found search button within the same form%22);%0D%0A                return searchButton;%0D%0A            %7D%0D%0A        %7D catch (Exception e) %7B%0D%0A            System.out.println(%22Could not find button in the same form: %22 + e.getMessage());%0D%0A        %7D%0D%0A        %0D%0A        // If still not found, try JavaScript as a last resort%0D%0A        try %7B%0D%0A            System.out.println(%22Trying to find search button using JavaScript...%22);%0D%0A            searchButton = (WebElement) ((JavascriptExecutor) driver).executeScript(%0D%0A                %22return document.querySelector('button%5Btype=%5C%22submit%5C%22%5D, input%5Btype=%5C%22submit%5C%22%5D');%22%0D%0A            );%0D%0A            if (searchButton != null && searchButton.isDisplayed()) %7B%0D%0A                System.out.println(%22Found search button using JavaScript%22);%0D%0A                return searchButton;%0D%0A            %7D%0D%0A        %7D catch (Exception e) %7B%0D%0A            System.out.println(%22JavaScript search failed: %22 + e.getMessage());%0D%0A        %7D%0D%0A        %0D%0A        return null;%0D%0A    %7D%0D%0A    %0D%0A    /**%0D%0A     * Verify that search results are displayed%0D%0A     */%0D%0A    private static boolean verifySearchResults(WebDriver driver, WebDriverWait wait) %7B%0D%0A        try %7B%0D%0A            // Wait for the page to load after search%0D%0A            wait.until(ExpectedConditions.titleContains(%22Mobile Phone%22) %7C%7C %0D%0A                       ExpectedConditions.urlContains(%22mobile%22) %7C%7C%0D%0A                       ExpectedConditions.urlContains(%22phone%22));%0D%0A            %0D%0A            System.out.println(%22Page title after search: %22 + driver.getTitle());%0D%0A            System.out.println(%22Current URL: %22 + driver.getCurrentUrl());%0D%0A            %0D%0A            // Check if the URL or title contains search terms%0D%0A            if (driver.getTitle().toLowerCase().contains(%22mobile%22) %7C%7C %0D%0A                driver.getTitle().toLowerCase().contains(%22phone%22) %7C%7C%0D%0A                driver.getCurrentUrl().toLowerCase().contains(%22mobile%22) %7C%7C%0D%0A                driver.getCurrentUrl().toLowerCase().contains(%22phone%22)) %7B%0D%0A                System.out.println(%22URL or title contains search terms%22);%0D%0A                return true;%0D%0A            %7D%0D%0A            %0D%0A            // Check for common result page elements%0D%0A            List%3CBy%3E resultLocators = List.of(%0D%0A                By.xpath(%22//div%5Bcontains(@class, 'product') or contains(@class, 'result')%5D%22),%0D%0A                By.xpath(%22//div%5Bcontains(@class, 'listing') or contains(@class, 'search')%5D%22),%0D%0A                By.xpath(%22//div%5Bcontains(@id, 'product') or contains(@id, 'result')%5D%22),%0D%0A                By.xpath(%22//h1%5Bcontains(text(), 'Mobile') or contains(text(), 'Phone')%5D%22)%0D%0A            );%0D%0A            %0D%0A            for (By locator : resultLocators) %7B%0D%0A                try %7B%0D%0A                    List%3CWebElement%3E elements = driver.findElements(locator);%0D%0A                    if (!elements.isEmpty()) %7B%0D%0A                        System.out.println(%22Found %22 + elements.size() + %22 result elements using: %22 + locator);%0D%0A                        return true;%0D%0A                    %7D%0D%0A                %7D catch (Exception e) %7B%0D%0A                    System.out.println(%22Error checking result elements: %22 + e.getMessage());%0D%0A                %7D%0D%0A            %7D%0D%0A            %0D%0A            // If no specific elements found, check if page content contains search terms%0D%0A            String pageSource = driver.getPageSource().toLowerCase();%0D%0A            if (pageSource.contains(%22mobile phone%22) %7C%7C %0D%0A                (pageSource.contains(%22mobile%22) && pageSource.contains(%22phone%22))) %7B%0D%0A                System.out.println(%22Page source contains search terms%22);%0D%0A                return true;%0D%0A            %7D%0D%0A            %0D%0A            return false;%0D%0A        %7D catch (Exception e) %7B%0D%0A            System.out.println(%22Error verifying search results: %22 + e.getMessage());%0D%0A            return false;%0D%0A        %7D%0D%0A    %7D%0D%0A    %0D%0A    /**%0D%0A     * Take a screenshot for debugging purposes%0D%0A     */%0D%0A    private static void takeScreenshot(WebDriver driver, String name) %7B%0D%0A        try %7B%0D%0A            File screenshot = ((TakesScreenshot) driver).getScreenshotAs(OutputType.FILE);%0D%0A            System.out.println(%22Screenshot taken: %22 + name + %22 (saved as: %22 + screenshot.getAbsolutePath() + %22)%22);%0D%0A        %7D catch (Exception e) %7B%0D%0A            System.out.println(%22Failed to take screenshot: %22 + e.getMessage());%0D%0A        %7D%0D%0A    %7D%0D%0A%7D
